conbody.p: A View State widget references a Triple'A Plus component page that accomplishes a business task in the pageflow. A View State marks a pause where the page is displayed during the pageflow of the user activity and that an action is required from the user for the flow to resume.

Although a View State always references a Triple'A Plus page, a View State is not equivalent to a Triple'A Plus page. The Design Studio (DS) Workbench application can display the same page in different business contexts, changing the State of the page. A Triple'A Plus component page can be referenced several times in the same pageflow if the States of this page are different. For example, a page that can display the same information in view mode and in update mode can be referenced by two distinct States of the pageflow.
